briefdescription.para: Flag indicating start command is pending.
Flag indicating reset command is pending.
Timestamp when overload was first detected.
Total number of start cycles executed.
Total number of overload events detected.

Maximum update() execution time in microseconds.

Hardware pin configuration for all instances.

parameterdescription.para: true to enable, false to disable

briefdescription.para: Check if sonicator is currently running.
Check if overload condition exists and throw an interrupt if so.

simplesect.para: this should throw an interrupt handled by the main loop if an Overload occurs

briefdescription.para: Main update function (call from main loop)

simplesect.para: Current sonicator state @mandatory Must be called at least every 10ms for proper operation @performance Optimized for real-time execution, typically completes in <1ms @thread_safety Not thread-safe - call only from main thread @error_handling Returns SONICATOR_STATE_FAULT on critical errors
This is a void operation that doesn't affect current state @thread_safety Not thread-safe - call only when sonicator is stopped

briefdescription.para: Update control outputs based on current state.

simplesect.para: true if outputs updated successfully, false on hardware error
Called internally by update() - typically not called directly @performance Optimized for minimal latency (<100s typical)

parameterdescription.para: A struct containing the pin definitions for this sonicator.

detaileddescription.para: Manages a single sonicator channel via a defined pin structure.
This class provides complete control and monitoring interface for a single CT2000 sonicator unit via DB9 connector.

Features:
Control Signals: Amplitude, Start/Stop, Overload Reset
Monitoring Signals:
Full amplitude control (20-100% via 0-10V DAC)
Start/stop control via relay output
Overload reset control
Real-time power monitoring
Frequency monitoring and lock detection
Safety monitoring with response time faster than MODBUS protocol requirements
Runtime statistics and fault logging
This class represents a group of pins that are used to control and monitor a single sonicator from the ATmega32A Multi Sonicator IO Controller

simplesect.para: This class is the base Sonicator Interface and there should be four instances of it, one for each sonicator. This pin definitions are defined in the hardware-config.yaml and pin-matrix.md
